Sentencas: Radiant heat transfer plays an important role in the distribution of cell temperature and current density in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: An analytical model of view factors for radiation heat transfer in planar and tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The objective of this paper is to introduce a mathematical model of view factors for radiation heat exchange in an in-house longitudinally distributed SOFC model.
Titulo: An analytical model of view factors for radiation heat transfer in planar and tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A differential view factor model is first developed for planar and tubular SOFC configurations, but is found invalid when the infinitesimal element size is comparable to the characteristic size.
Titulo: An analytical model of view factors for radiation heat transfer in planar and tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Then, a finite-difference view factor model is developed to solve the problem of discontinuities in the differential view factor model.
Titulo: An analytical model of view factors for radiation heat transfer in planar and tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Starting from a classical problem of convective and radiant heat transfer for a transparent gas flow in a gray-wall tube, a fast and accurate computation is available for the finite-difference view factor model without extra mathematical derivations of the governing equations.
Titulo: An analytical model of view factors for radiation heat transfer in planar and tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Compared to the simple modeling which only takes into account the surface-to-surface radiation exchange between two directly opposed elements, the detailed radiation model based on analytical view factors predicts more uniform distribution of cell temperature and current density in the overall SOFC modeling.
Titulo: An analytical model of view factors for radiation heat transfer in planar and tubular solid oxide fuel cells
